summary: Badgers are short-legged, digging animals related to otters and weasels. They are known for their squat bodies and strong jaws, perfect for digging and eating various foods. There are many badger species, including the European badger, American badger, and honey badger. These creatures have distinctive black and white faces, grey bodies, and striped tails. They can grow up to 35 inches long, with some Eurasian badgers weighing as much as 40 pounds. Badgers live in underground burrows and are excellent diggers.
title: Badger
